meanings.definition: Relating to the diploë, the spongy layer of bone found between the inner and outer layers of the skull.
meanings.sent1: The diploic layer provides cushioning for the skull.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the diploic structure of the skull for research.
meanings.sent3: The diploic bone seemed to have a bouncy quality, like a tiny trampoline.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts echoed in her mind, bouncing off the diploic walls of her skull.
meanings.sent5: The diploic layer felt like a soft pillow protecting her brain.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the diploic veins, which are veins found in the diploë of the skull.
meanings.sent1: The diploic veins help in maintaining proper blood flow in the skull.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the diploic veins during the check-up.
meanings.sent3: The diploic veins looked like tiny rivers flowing through the skull.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions coursed through her like diploic veins, carrying feelings to her heart.
meanings.sent5: The diploic veins were like lifelines, ensuring oxygen reached every part of the brain.
